CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection joined to merits and dismissed (Article 35-1 - Exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of Article 11 - Freedom of assembly and association (Article 11-1 - Freedom of peaceful assembly);Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Guido Raimondi;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant intended to organise demonstrations in order to call attention to the situation of those having sustained damage originating in a major bankruptcy case which had attracted considerable media attention in GPE . On DATE he applied to ORG for acquiescence in a demonstration on DATE and in another one , of ongoing nature , from DATE until DATE , both scheduled in FAC , in front of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to deal with either of the applications . It observed that on DATE the area in question had been declared by ORG itself a “ security operational zone ” ( biztonsági műveleti terület ) in view of the tumultuous events in GPE in DATE . Consequently , the measure – which was , after a prolongation , in place for an indefinite period of time – remained as such outside ORG competence as regards the prohibition of , or acquiescence in , a demonstration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG upheld this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request for judicial review , endorsing in essence the police authorities’ reasoning . This decision was served on DATE .

CARDINAL . In another case concerning the same area , on DATE a Mr PERSON challenged the police ’s very decision to declare FAC a “ security operational zone ” . On DATE the Budapest Police Commander rejected his complaint , but this decision was quashed by the ORG Commander on DATE . In the resumed administrative proceedings , on DATE the GPE Commander again rejected the complaint . On DATE the ORG Commander upheld this decision . PERSON challenged this ruling in court .
CARDINAL . Mr PERSON ’s action was dismissed by ORG . However , on appeal ORG quashed this decision , together with the one of DATE .
CARDINAL . In the resumed second - instance administrative proceedings , on DATE the ORG Commander again upheld the GPE Commander ’s decision . PERSON requested judicial review .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed , in judgment no . CARDINAL.K.CARDINAL.CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL . , both the first- and the second - instance administrative decisions and remitted the case to the GPE Commander . The court pointed out that the impugned decisions did not contain any concrete elements establishing the necessity and proportionality of maintaining the “ security operational zone ” after the prolongation of DATE . Nor did they address the plaintiff ’s suggestion that the mere fencing - off of ORG ’s immediate vicinity – rather than the global ban on FAC – would have been sufficient in the circumstances .

CARDINAL . In the resumed first - instance administrative proceedings , on DATE the GPE Commander partly sustained PERSON complaint , noting that , in the absence of evidence to the contrary , the proportionality of the impugned measure had successfully been challenged .
